review_data: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 7, 2023
name: SC
title: Very cute, but wrong pictures linked to product selection
review: This is a very cute toy that helps young kids work on fine motor skills, dexterity, creativity, and visual-spatial skills.It's a great, quiet, toy for travel.It would be nice if the magnetic pencil was tethered to the board to keep it from getting lost, but overall, I like it.Felt like we were making designs out of M&M's.Overall, I like the concept.I would keep an eye on younger kids, since if the pen breaks, or the clear plastic window breaks, you'd have a lot of potential choking hazards.The clear plastic window gets scratched up VERY easily from the uneven magnet in the "pen".Since the magnet is glued in unevenly, there's a rough surface on one side that is probably making the plastic window get scratched more easily than it should.The main reason that it lost two stars for not being as pictured in the description (currently, hopefully they update it).It's possible that there's a large and medium version of the duck and they accidentally put the LARGE photo in the images for MEDIUM, but it's not what I was expecting.In the image posted, it shows a toy that has 18 columns and 13 rows.That's 234 "pixels" where an child could get creative and make lots of different designs.Instead of what was pictured, I got the same yellow duck, but the play space has a large white border, with a play area of 7 rows and 7 columns, that's only 49 "pixels".Much more simple and better suited for younger kids, disappointed that the item doesn't match the picture.The sixth picture down (currently) shows what you'd actually be getting, a smaller 7X7 grid.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 6, 2023
name: Megan Boomershine
title: Fun, but terrible sealed compartment
review: What I love:- fun activity for small children, toddler age and up.- sealed design, so I don't have to worry about missing magnets or choking hazards. Still use only under adult supervision due to the potential for the case to break.- 5 colors makes this simple for little kids.- the case is fun!- lots of designs to copy- a slot for the card to stand in while you copy the design- slot to keep the magnet pen.- relaxing activity!- easy to use! The pen holds the magnet pieces and drags them into place easily.What I don't love:- the quality of the sealed compartment is lacking. The sheet is already scratched after only a few days. It feels loose, like you can move it around, and press on the sheet and it dips in. For a toy with magnets, advertised for 3+, a high quality sealed compartment should have been a priority. I think it's a thin plastic sheet like you'd expect on a dollar store toy? It should have been something significantly stronger.Overall, the quality makes me feel like this should be a $10 ($15 tops) toy, for which I'd recommend. 2 stars off for quality, since I'll most likely toss this once the sheet is broken and at $20 that feels like a very bad price (not to mention bad for the environment).I love everything else about this, though! If the quality of materials were improved this would easily be 5 stars because it's a fun activity! I even like using it myself, to be honest.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 6, 2023
name: PK
title: Contained Fun
review: This is a wonderful toy for my 3 and 6 year old grandchildren. The pieces stay within the plastic cover so there will be no missing pieces.The magnetic wand is not attached, which would have been preferred but there is an area to snap the pen in so it does not get lost. This comes with patterns to copy which is helpful, but you can do any thing your creative mind comes up with. It is a great item for the car or for the ‚Äúgo bag‚Äù to keep the kids busy!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 5, 2023

review_data: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 5, 2023
name: CDE
title: Lower quality then what we had 30+ years ago.
review: This looks fun at first, but then you notice the build quality. Isn't that great. The magnet pen doesn't have any attachment string like many other devices do. The cards reek of chemical smell. The front plastic is thin and flimsy, not thicker material like they used to have. It also scratches very easily. Some of the discs were not smoothly shaved, leaving rough edges which makes some hard to set. The indents are very deep, so it's harder to get the pieces to stay put. And the amount of colored discs are unbalanced. Also, the small size uses the same casing as the bigger one, but holds much fewer pieces than what would actually fit.It would be fun for some kids, but with a more limited number of variable colors and a very limited quantity of each, some much more than others, It only hampers some creativity and therefore has a decreased replay value.It is a horrible, but it isn't great either. It could be so much better with a few quality improvements on manufacturing and materials.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2023
name: Kevin R
title: Super creative and fun toy
review: This is very creative and fun. This is a great gift really for any toddler up to young kid age. It‚Äôs a nice size, but not too big for them to take along with them to keep them occupied. My five-year-old daughter loves it. It comes with different patterns and ideas of what to make the little pen attract the magnets, and you can move them wherever you want. Makes no noise so great for a take along to restaurants, church, appointments, etc instead of screens. Really glad we got this!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2023
name: C. Daley III
title: Love the Portability
review: We love that all the pieces are contained in one item which makes for great portability during travel or for restaurant entertainment.Some Notes:- Magnet pen does not have a string attached, so this could get lost- Magnet in pen could get dislodged if chewed on by child/infant causing a major hazard

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2023
name: Chelsea
title: Nice toy
review: The media could not be loaded.¬†I really like this toy and so do my kids. I gave it four stars because I feel there should have been a spot built into the toy to store the cards. I also think the cards should be laminated so they are more durable especially since this is a toy for little kids. Other then that it is very well made, the design is cute and it keeps my little one well entertained.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2023
name: LA
title: This might be my favorite toy so far this year
review: I'm in love with this magnetic toy. The magnetic pen is stored in a little opening in the front. It's easy to put in and take out. It comes with 14 designs, 2 on each of the 7 cards, to mimic. Once the pen is removed, a card can be placed in the small opening for the card to stand up. It's best to slightly put it in. Otherwise pushing the card all the way down will cause it to tilt a little.The drawing board has a clear covering with visibility to the colorful magnets. The magnets looks like a popular candy. It's easy to move the magnets into the empty circles to make the design on one of the card designs or to make ones own design.Titling the board down removes the magnets from the circular spaces.Since it's a kids toy, laminated cards would be helpful. It would also be nice if there were more cards; perhaps to include the alphabet or numbers or shapes.This would be a really fun concept for a multipack for adults to compete against eachother; even for team building.I certainly recommend the magnetic drawing board.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2023
name: LoveMyLife
title: Five Stars for this toddler toy
review: This little magnetic match game checks all of the boxes.It is self-contained so there are no loose beads. The wand tool is magnetic and sticks to the board.The bright colors help keep a child's attention, and they can follow the match cards or 'draw' their own designs.This is a cute educational toy, helps develop hand/eye coordidnation, and allows creativity at the same time.Perfect toy for those daily car trips.5 stars!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2023
name: Pastor B
title: A Toy Combining Drawing with Bright-Colored Magnets ‚Äì What‚Äôs Not to Love?
review: This is an awesome creative toy for my grandchildren.I‚Äôm always looking for toys that will catch their attention and inspire their creativity, and this is one of those toys!I ordered the 7 by 7 Yellow Duck version of this magnetic drawing tool (see below), and there are larger versions available as well.There are little colored magnetic disks (not magnets themselves, but able to be moved by the magnet in the stylus) are secured behind a transparent cover (it‚Äôs good that they are behind that cover, because they look so good that they‚Äôd certainly be eaten).You use a magnetic stylus to grab a colored disk and move it to the grid above and then raise the stylus when the disk is where you want it to be.If you want to move it again, just pick it up again with the stylus.You (or your small one) can draw to their heart‚Äôs content, creating whatever they want.There are cards included which you can use as patterns to make your designs, and that‚Äôs good practice in transferring some design in front of you to your own artwork, but I like the idea of free play better!I really like this game made by HINSLEAMER and sold by SICTTSID!I suspect (since I already have done so) that I will find myself occasionally playing with it when my grandchildren are not around!

ITS A MST HAVE FOR TRAVELING AWAY FROM HOME

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2023
name: newuser
title: Very entertaining!
review: The media could not be loaded.¬†I got this HINSLEAMER toy for my three-year-old daughter. It keeps her entertained for hours. I like that it is safe to use, and the beads are enclosed inside a plastic panel. There are several suggested patterns included to inspire kids to draw. One issue is that the magnetic pen is not connected to the item with a string, therefore it is very easy to lose. This toy has a great value for the price and I would recommend it to a friend.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2023
name: gail
title: Artistic kid? This would be fun!
review: This is a different type of art project board from anything I have used before.There are 14 cardboard designs and you put one in the slot and make it happen on your magnetic board.All of the round disks are inside the board with a clear plastic top so that nothing can escape.Use the magnetic wand to move the disks around and drop them into the round dent in the bottom of the board.This is a simple design in the best possible way‚Ä¶.no lights , bells. Or whistles, just a quiet game for one person.Good for hand dexterity, pattern recognition, learning colors, making a design or thinking up your own.There is a snug spot for the magnetic wand and this stores pretty flat on the game shelf.It feels well made and it should last a long time with normal usage.This comes in a box and would make a nice gift.Easy to take along when traveling or to a restaurant.It takes some concentration to get the disks where they need to go, so this could buy you a chunk of quiet time in your house!I would purchase it again.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2023
name: Allen
title: Interesting but the can be a struggle to play with
review: I have to give some credit to the creativity to create a magnetic drawing board. Okay so first, you don't really draw with the HINSLEAMER 10.3‚Äù Magnetic Drawing Board. It comes with a magnetic pen that you'll pull the small colorful pieces into the placement rack. This in itself takes a bit of focus and time. Something that most toddlers and kids lack. Second, there are some design guides you can follow and create a completed image but those designs aren't very interesting (at least in my opinion). In terms of design though, the HINSLEAMER 10.3‚Äù Magnetic Drawing Board comes with a slot for the magnetic pen along with a mount for the design guides. That being said, the HINSLEAMER 10.3‚Äù Magnetic Drawing Board hasn't quite drawn the attention from my toddler as some other toys but only time will tell. I've attached a close-up photo of the toy here. I hope this helps!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 22, 2023
name: OneCent
title: Entertaining, just hope it lasts
review: This is a fun fidget toy for my 4.7 yr old. He can do it just fine and seems entertained for at least one drawing at a time. I like the concept a lot, and hope it would last. The front clear panel is a thin piece of plastic and I worry that it would break from any messing around. The magnet at the tip of the pen is exposed and scratches this surface each time you move a stone, so that would add to the fragility. I wish the tip of the pen was covered with something soft so it doesn‚Äôt scratch like that. The colors are bright and bold.The pattern card can be put into a slot at the top of the game. The pen goes in there too, but in only one direction which you learn from trial and error. There is no place to put the cards while not drawing, so I ended up keeping the box to contain the parts.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 21, 2023
name: SuburbanMom
title: For young children
review: I remember having such toys back when I was a kid and they were quite entertaining.The quality certainly is not what it used to be. And that‚Äôs the reason I deducted one star. It‚Äôs decent quality, although I‚Äôd spend a bit less for it.I feel that this is good for preschool and lower elementary age. It can be a bit difficult for toddlers to maneuver the magnets properly. The pictures are simple and easy to follow.For the age range above, it‚Äôs a great toy/game, especially for travel.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 17, 2023
name: Amazon customer
title: Flimsy
review: The idea behind this toy is great, but this particular one uses very poor quality materials. It felf quite flimsy right out of the box. The frontclear plastic casing pushes right down onto the inner plastic piece. It feels as if it will break easily. Also, it has scratches all over from just a few uses. There aren't as many circles to place the magnets as with others. There are empty gaps on 3 sides instead of just at the bottom. The pen picks up and moves the magnets well, and it is fun to play with. You can make the designs on the little cards or go freestyle. The pieces remind us of M&Ms. My kids like this toy; I just wish it was built better to hold up and last longer.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 17, 2023
name: Cynthia Sanchez
title: Kind Of Difficult For Little Hands
review: I am a mother of a two-year-old boy and I saw this magnetic drawing board and thought it would be perfect for him.First, this toy is not awful; however, it feels like it might be a little better for older kids than maybe the younger ones. The toy itself is made pretty well and the magnetic dots work pretty well; however, you do have to have patience and make sure this board is completely flat. I noticed that if you have the board at an angle of any sort, it will not work as well. The magnetic pen does work pretty well but you will notice sometimes it takes a couple of times for it to pick up a dot. After noticing that this requires a lot more motor skills than my toddler can do, I feel like this will be better for when he's a few years older.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 16, 2023

title: Nice for a child that fidgets.
review: My grandson loves fidget toys. This will keep him occupied for quite awhile. I don't think the value is all that great for the price. It feels cheaply made.
